revision.comment: 'IPFire' seems to be used by the project, at least, as of the time of posting
revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Linksys |model=E4200 |revision=v2 |upc=745883594900 |asin=B0068ALV8Q |serialnum_prefix=01C106, 01C116, 01C136 |fcc_date=09/22/2011 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Wistron NeWeb |manuf_model=RGWM04 |manuf_rev=.0GA |type=wireless router |fcc_id=Q87-E4200V2 |ic_id=3839A-E4200V2 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Marvell |cpu1_model=88F6282 |cpu1_cspeed=1.2 GHz |fla1=128 |fla1_brand=Hynix |fla1_model=H5PS1G63EFR-S6C |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=Hynix |ram1_model=H27U1G8F2BTR-BC |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=1 |serial=yes,, 6-pin header,, (115200,8,N,1) |wi1_chip1_brand=Marvell |wi1_chip1_model=88W8366 |wi1_chip2_brand=Marvell |wi1_chip2_model=88W8063 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=3 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=3 |wi2_chip1_brand=Marvell |wi2_chip1_model=88W8366 |wi2_chip2_brand=Marvell |wi2_chip2_model=88W8063 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=3 |wi2_rxchains=3 |wi2_sstreams=3 |eth_cpu=true |sw_brand=Marvell |sw_model=88E6171R |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips=2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks (SiGe);SE2598L;SiGe, 2598L, 144ED;3; ,,, 5GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks (SiGe);SE2567L;SiGe, 2567L, 144ED;3; ,,, 2A, 2V Non-Synchronous Buck Converter;Texas Instruments;TPS54231;;1; ,,, 4.5V/18V Synchronous Step-Down Three Buck Switcher;Texas Instruments;TPS65251;;1; ,,, 4.5V/18V Synchronous Step-Down Buck Switcher;Texas Instruments;TPS54325;;1; ,,, Precision Timer;Texas Instruments;NA555;;1; |stock_boot=U-Boot |stock_os=Linux |tp_firmware=OpenWrt (unofficially), Debian, IPFire |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui=58:6D:8F,C0:C1:C0 |oui_eth=58:6D:8F,C0:C1:C0 }} {{TagLine|Maximum Performance Dual-Band N Router}} :{{SupportPage|vendor=Linksys|model=E4200|pid=01t80000003K7blAAC}}
"48RGWM04.0GA" and "Manufactured for CISCO" are silkscreened on the board. :[[Wistron NeWeb]] is the OEM.
The same hardware appears to be used with the later model [[Linksys EA4500]]. :[http://certifications.wi-fi.org/pdf_certificate.php?cid=WFA12602 Wi-Fi Certified] {{TechInfoDepot|Linksys_E4200_v2}}
===Reviews=== *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/31651-cisco-linksys-e4200v2-dual-band-n900-router-reviewed On '''SmallNetBuilder'''] (source for this page)
===Forum threads=== *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=652649 On the ''DD-WRT'' forums] :The serial number for these devices may start with :[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=148893 ''01C106''], [http://homecommunity.cisco.com/t5/Wireless-Routers/How-to-determine-E4200-V1-or-V2/td-p/481308/page/2''01C116''], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Linksys_routers&action=historysubmit&diff=494570129&oldid=487275551 ''01C136''].
===Blogs=== *[http://techhappens.blog.com/2012/10/26/making-the-ciscolinksys-e4200v2-work-for-you/ ''Making the Cisco/Linksys E4200v2'' work for you] *[http://bramp.net/blog/2012/01/obtaining-the-firmware-for-linksys-e4200v2/ ''Obtaining the firmware for Linksys E4200v2''] :[http://bramp.net/blog/2012/01/hacking-linksys-e4200v2-firmware/ ''Hacking Linksys E4200v2 firmware''] (binwalk dump)
===Firmware=== *[http://www.wolfteck.com/projects/candyhouse/ ''Hacking the Linksys E4200v2''] :(based on and extending work from the following) :[http://www.wolfteck.com/projects/candyhouse/install/ ''Installing Debian on the Linksys E4200v2'']
